results.title: 1957 Pig Carcase Competition
results.brief_description: Details and promotes the 1957 Pig Carcase competition as well as pork production in Victoria as a whole. Similar to the 1955 Pig Carcase competition in format and style. Includes various shots of carcases being cut for display, general crowd shots, an awards ceremony and a speech by an official. Features fantastic footage of three carcases hanging up in front of a black backdrop being inspected and caressed by a man. Nice theatrical quality to it. Excellent shot of a boy inspecting pork shot from behind, highlighting very cute jeans. End of piece features an official from the Board of Meat, aided by illustrations, talking about how pork production in Victoria has improved over time. Behind him hang carcases and behind them there is a red wall. He wears a pink and red tie. This creates a quirky, very good-looking frame of man, meat and pig illustration. Soundtrack features music of the period and earnest narration about ‘pig raisers’.

results.title: 30 Seconds to go
results.brief_description:
Shot at a Mildura television station. Details how an episode of ‘On the Land’ is broadcast by inter-cutting between an installment of the programme and conventional ‘behind the scenes’ footage of a television studio. This includes shots of a camera operator, the television station’s studio, vision-switching and so on.

Actual ‘On the Land’ programme featured, contains information on good seeds to sow and non-hormonal spraying techniques. Contains exterior shots of an orchid.

Film opens with exterior shots of Mildura that begin at river and then move into more general street scenes. This lasts for two minutes.

results.title: 16mm Prints
results.brief_description:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.

results.title: acmipark
results.material_description: software, computers, monitors, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
acmipark is multiplayer virtual world. Created by selectparks (artists Julian Oliver, Chad Chatterton, and Andrea Blundell), it was designed to extend the physical spaces of the Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) at Melbourne’s Federation Square into the realms of virtual space. It was produced using a game engine as its base, and worked up from the real architectural designs produced for Federation Square by Lab Architecture Studio.

Designed as a soundpark, it is a musical instrument which can be played collectively, and, like Federation Square itself, it was envisaged as a kind of public space waiting for a community to define its meaning.

It was conceived as an experiment in the design of a virtual public space. It is an embodiment of the idea that we are moving our public space into the realm of the virtual. By using a model of a real world public space combined with the collaborative possibilities of the soundpark and the kinaesthetic pleasures of moving through a beautiful virtual place, selectparks hoped to build upon traditional concepts of ‘public’ places.

[Source: Helen Stuckey, 2006 https://firstmonday.org/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/1561/1476 last accessed 20/10/2020]

results.title: What the Water Gave Me

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.description: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.
description_for_label: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
description_for_label: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
